content: AMA SG Young Investment Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Sep 2018Is there any website or platform to see if certain stocks is undervalued or overvalued? Or do you usually do your own calculations?5 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Nicholes WongLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 12 Sep 2018Price to book ratio can tell, less than 1 is undervalued and more than 1 is overvalued technically. However, its not that straight forward because certain companies can have quite high PB ratio but still good to invest in. Cant tell you more not too sure as well. You also have to see why the company is undervalue before buying the shares just because its undervalue. 0 comments2

Eric Chia, Senior Financial Consultant at PrudentialLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 13 Sep 2018I use this: https://www.fool.sg/They provide news on stocks which gives me an idea of whether the stock is undervalued or overvalued. Price to book ratio is a good technical indicator but prices are driven by market sentiments.â€‹And to shortlist which stock I go for I use https://www.dividends.sg/Because I am in more for the dividend strategy.0 comments1

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Own calculations. I just need info from yahoo finance for the hard data.. Then a couple of other sites for confirmation before opening the position 0 comments0

Dwivid SharmaLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 14 Sep 2018Hi there,I would love to share my secret with you for evaluating dividend stocksI mostly invest in dividend stocks. I do my analysis and take reference from several websites such ashttps://www.shareinvestor.comhttps://investingnote.comhttps://www.mmfsolutions.sg/blog/https://www.fool.sg/https://www.dividends.sg/I got stocks updates and news form all these websites. I do the manual calculation to calculate the price to book ratio. this helps me to search for fundamentals about a particular stock.0 comments0

Rave Ong Ci DeLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 14 Sep 2018Do own calculations. Most website uses data from Thomson Reuters. If there is a glitch in the data, the analysis is wrong. Sometimes it is better to fish on ownself than to see other people fishing. 0 comments0
